meanings.definition: Belonging to something as a right or attribute.
meanings.sent1: The appurtenant decorations added a festive touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: The appurtenant responsibilities came with the new job.
meanings.sent3: The appurtenant party hats made everyone look silly.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was appurtenant to her generous nature.
meanings.sent5: The appurtenant stars in the sky twinkled brightly.

meanings.definition: Attached or pertaining to something as a subordinate or accessory.
meanings.sent1: The appurtenant garage provided extra storage space.
meanings.sent2: The appurtenant documents were filed in a separate folder.
meanings.sent3: The appurtenant keychain jingled merrily as she walked.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were appurtenant to his friendly demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The appurtenant shadows followed them closely as they walked.
